item.title: Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor - Best Class Mods to Pick
item.description:
Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor has come a long way since its early access release. With the recent couple of updates adding new weapons, overclocks, artifacts, and all-new masteries, returning players should take heed that their beloved class mods might not feel as powerful as they were before.

That said, other class mods have become even more powerful when built right. While players have no choice but to grind all the new masteries for power boosts, here are the best class mods to make that grind easier in DRG: Survivor .

5 Driller - Strong Armed

Lob Dozens of Explosions at Once

Class Mod Requirement

Reach Class Rank 18 with Driller.

Passives and Bonuses

  • Grants +20 percent range to all Throwable weapons.
  • Gives access to all currently unlocked Throwable weapons.

Starting Weapon

Impact Axe

Best Weapons for Strong Armed

  • Cryo Grenade
  • High Explosive Grenade
  • Neurotoxin Grenade
  • Shredder Swarm Grenade
  • Tactical Leadburster

One mistake new players often make is leveling up the Driller to unlock its last class mod only to find their efforts wasted. This is because the Stronged Armed Driller is one of the hardest class mods to play in DRG: Survivor . It is not friendly for new players at all.

Its weapon range bonus is not impressive when compared to others. Its starting weapon is perhaps decent but with fairly frustrating clearance speed. The entire Throwable build takes at least the first couple of levels to start doing damage, and that too if luck has thrown some excellent upgrades during the run.

However, the Strong Armed Driller becomes a beast after unlocking Cluster Grenades for the main Throwables. With hundreds of explosions happening all over the map at once, this is the only class mod in the game that has such a large area of impact.

Make sure to always pick Cryo Grenade for the Strong Armed Driller. It freezes half of the map, which is pretty useful when running Hollow Bough, the most difficult biome in DRG: Survivor .

4 Driller - Interrogator

Trade Bullets for Improved Fire and Acid Damage

Class Mod Requirement

Reach Class Rank 9 with Driller.

Passives and Bonuses

  • Grants +100 percent status effect damage, but at the cost of -30 percent damage.
  • Gives access to all currently unlocked Fire and Acid weapons.

Starting Weapon

CRSPR Flamethrower

Best Weapons for Interrogator

  • Colette Wave Cooker
  • Corrosive Sludge Pump
  • Krakatoa Sentinel
  • Nishanka Boltshark X-80

The Driller has always been a popular class because of his fast mining speed, especially if players are looking to farm resources to unlock upgrades in DRG: Survivor . With the Interrogator class mod, the Driller improves his clearance speed further by burning and melting enemies in a large radius around him within seconds.

Returning players might be surprised to see the Interrogator Driller ranked highly because elemental damage used to fall off significantly in Hazards 4 and 5. Thanks to the new Potency mechanic, which arrived with the second update, players can add Damage-Over-Time (DoT) stacks faster and increase the maximum number of DoTs possible for all enemies. Combined with the Interrogator's 100 percent status effect damage bonus, elemental damage scales far better than before in the later Hazards to make the Driller almost untouchable.

When choosing weapons and upgrades for an Interrogator Driller built in DRG: Survivor , always choose Fire as the primary damage . Fire stacks are incredibly strong with high enough Potency. Acid, on the other hand, does not do that much damage on its own. It is mainly used to soften targets to receive increased damage from other sources. Hence, pick a Corrosive Sludge Pump for that purpose and leave the remaining weapon slots for Fire weapons such as the Colette Wave Cooker and Krakatoa Sentinel.

3 Scout - Sharp Shooter

Spit Critical Hits All Day Long

Class Mod Requirement

Reach Class Rank 18 with Scout.

Passives and Bonuses

  • Grants +15 percent Critical Chance and +50 percent Critical Damage.
  • Dealing overkill damage causes a shrapnel explosion.

Starting Weapon

M1000 Classic

Best Weapons for Sharp Shooter

  • Drak-25 Plasma Carbine
  • Jury-Rigged Boomstick
  • Nishanka Boltshark X-80
  • Zhukov NUK17

The Scout already features improved critical multipliers by default. Sharp Shooter improves that even further by stacking more critical chance and critical damage to give players one of the highest damage-dealing class mods in Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor .

Something else that helps the class mod amplify damage is its secondary passive, which unleashes shrapnel explosions after dealing overkill damage. It combines with the aforementioned critical bonuses to let players do not only insane damage but insane single-target damage to melt enemies with large health pools. This is especially useful when running Hazard 5, where the biggest hurdle is maintaining enough single-target damage to clear a path through large and armored enemies.

This is also what makes the M1000 Classic the perfect weapon for a Scout. It targets enemies with the highest health and almost every hit is guaranteed to be overkill. When piercing a swarm of enemies, every enemy killed will unleash a powerful explosion that can start a chain reaction to clear out the whole area.

The M1000 Classic, as well as the other recommended Medium weapons, desperately need faster firing rates and faster reloads. Hence, do not be afraid to pick global upgrades that target all Medium weapons when running Scout builds in DRG: Survivor .

2 Gunner - Heavy Gunner

Stand and Fight With Improved Heavy Weapons

Class Mod Requirement

Reach Class Rank 18 with Gunner.

Passives and Bonuses

  • Grants +25 percent range and reload speed to Heavy weapons, but at the cost of -10 percent movement speed.
  • Gives access to all currently unlocked Heavy weapons.

Starting Weapon

"Thunderhead" Heavy Autocannon

Best Weapons for Heavy Gunner

  • Cryo Cannon
  • "Lead Storm" Powered Minigun
  • Tactical Leadburster

The Heavy Gunner is a rather unique class mod in terms of handling. The entire Gunner build relies solely on its starting weapon, the "Thunderhead" Heavy Autocannon, which could well be one of the best-starting weapons in Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor . It can deal huge damage while knocking back targets at long range. Pair it with a "Lead Storm" Powered Minigun, and players can melt entire swarms without moving an inch.

While the Heavy Gunner class mod improves the reload speed and range for all Heavy weapons, most of the other Heavy weapons do elemental damage. They will never synergize as well with the Heavy Autocannon as some of the other Medium weapons. Hence, building a Heavy Gunner means having lots of room for experimentation.

Due to reduced mobility and how the Heavy Gunner is forced to unleash his entire payload in a single direction, the Tactical Leadburster with its Cluster Grenades upgrade is a good pick to clear surrounding swarms. Having the Cryo Cannon is also a good option to freeze enemies at a decent range and stop them from boxing players in.

1 Gunner - Juggernaut

Become an Armored Tank That Hits Harder

Class Mod Requirement

Reach Class Rank 9 with Gunner.

Passives and Bonuses

  • Grants +10 armor and +50 maximum health, but at the cost of -50 percent weapon range.
  • Grants +10 percent damage for 10 seconds after taking damage, which stacks up to 5 times.

Starting Weapon

"Bulldog" Heavy Revolver

Best Weapons for Juggernaut

  • "Lead Storm" Powered Minigun
  • "Thunderhead" Heavy Autocannon
  • Seismic Repulsor

The Gunner has the highest survival chance among all playable classes in DRG: Survivor . With the Juggernaut class mod, and once all the armor upgrades are unlocked, players can expect an already tanky class to become even tankier. Suffice it to say, the Juggernaut Gunner has everything needed to dominate Hazard 5 runs.

The "Bulldog" Heavy Revolver might not be that efficient compared to some of the other starting weapons, but it does hit like a truck after fully upgraded. The primary damage, though, will come from the "Thunderhead" Heavy Autocannon. Furthermore, it is always recommended to have the Seismic Repulsor to knock back enemies since the Gunner has low mobility.

All that said, it does take a veteran's hand to make the most of the Juggernaut. Do not be afraid to take a few hits to stack up the damage bonus. For example, when running the Magma Core, stand on the lava to get some stacks against bosses. Players can always restore their health by leveling up or during the preparation phase of the next level.

The following gameplay footage shows how the Juggernaut Gunner fares against the Dreadnought Twins with ease.

item.title: Metyr, Mother of Fingers Boss Guide In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Find Metyr, Mother Of Fingers
  • Boss Guide
  • Recommended Equipment Against Metyr, Mother of Fingers
  • Best Strategies Against Metyr, Mother Of Fingers
  • Reward For Defeating Metyr, Mother of Fingers

There are few fights in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree as creepy and mesmerizing as Metyr, Mother of Fingers. It's a grotesque mass of hands and fingers, with one enlarged index finger that serves as its "head." Its attacks range from creepy finger movements to luminescent spells that light up the entire arena.

Figuring out the best ways to avoid its attacks and fit in your own will require some choreography and plenty of deaths to get the timing just right. Its finger attacks can be comically clumsy, but its spells are a headache to dodge. Here's our guide to defeating this boss and the best ways to dodge some of its ridiculous attacks.

Where To Find Metyr, Mother Of Fingers

Metyr can be found close to the end of Ymir's questline. Once you've reached the necessary step in that quest, approach the empty throne and touch it. It'll slide backward and reveal a secret ladder leading below the church. Descend the latter, enter the Finger Ruins of Miyr, fight Swordhand of Night Anna, and head up to the top of the hill.

Your Tarnished will be prompted to sound the Finger Stone there. Once you do that, you'll be teleported into a separate arena where Metyr will be waiting for you.

Boss Guide

Metyr will open its fight up in one of two ways: they'll either fire a laser at you or slowly crawl at you. If it fires a laser at you, input a dodge the moment you see the laser heading toward you. Alternatively, you could also dodge the moment you see the charge-up ring disappear.

Regardless of what opening it chooses, its next attack will be a "head" slam, where Metyr will lift itself up and slam its head toward the player. Wait for a moment as Metyr prepares the attack, then dodge as you see the finger headed toward you.

Once that's finished, Metyr will choose from a few different attacks to do. After each attack, there's usually a small window to fit in a few light attacks or a single uncharged heavy attack. Here's a general list of Metyr's moves and how to dodge them:

Attack Name

Description

How To Dodge

"Head" Slam

Metyr does a small push-up to lift its "head" up before slamming it into the player's location. Metyr may then immediately leap up and slam its head again at the player's location up to two more times.

Press dodge when you see Metyr's upper body move downward. After you've dodged the attack, pause for a moment and see if Metyr follows up with more attacks. If Metyr does a follow-up attack, immediately dodge when you see Metyr off the ground. After the third attack, there will be no follow-up attacks and you can attack back.

Jump Slams

A variation of the "Head" slam. Metyr will tense for a moment then leap up and slam its head toward the player in a swinging motion up to three times.

Dodging this attack is similar to the head slam with one important variation - its final slam is slightly delayed. Press dodge when you see Metyr's chest pause in the air for a moment.

Bongo Hands

Metyr slams the ground with its left hand, then immediately slams the ground with its right hand like it's playing a bongo drum. After that, Metyr slams the ground with both hands up to three times.

Dodge backward when you see Metyr's left hand move downward. This will make the left hand miss and will sometimes stop the attack chain there. If Metyr does its follow-up slams, press dodge as both of its hands reach their maximum height, then immediately press dodge again to avoid the next few strikes.

Body Slam

Metyr rears up on its hind fingers and, after a short pause, slams downward toward the player.

Wait until the two fingers underneath Metyr's arms move apart, then press dodge. There is a large opening after successfully dodging this attack.

Two Finger Piano

Metyr will lean backward then quickly press two of its fingers at the player like it's pressing piano keys. After that, Metyr will sometimes turn to its side and splay out its fingers. This attack is usually done if you're too close to Metyr.

When you see Metyr rear backward, dodge backward for the easiest timing since the first part of this attack has a shrot range. When Metyr turns to its side, press dodge when you see its fingers curling.

Two Swipes

Metyr will wind up with its right hand before swiping at the player. This is followed shortly by a swipe with its left hand.

Dodge when Metyr's right-hand pauses for a moment or when its fingers are fully flexed outward. Then, immediately dodge to your right.

Jump Away Worm Spray

Metyr will tear into itself, and leap into the air above the player, spraying a disgusting curtain of worm-like fingers below it. This attack can have Metyr land on the player. If the player is far enough away after it lands, Metyr will charge a laser and slowly sweep it at the player.

Dodge toward Metyr when it leaps above you to make sure you don't take damage from the worm spray. After that, dodge away from Metyr as it passes over your head to avoid the following slam. If Metyr sweeps its laser at the player, start running at Metyr. When the laser is just barely out of the right side of your screen, dodge diagonally to the right toward the laser to avoid it.

Finger Crawl

Metyr turns to its side, rears up, curls its side fingers, then crawls toward the player with its fingers. This attack can do a lot of damage if it's not dodged.

Sprint away when you see it rear up from its side. If you're too close, mash dodges backward as much as possible.

Spawn Fingers

Metyr will tear open the mass on its chest and create two or three small finger enemies.

Attack into the red area Metyr is using to create its minions. This will both damage the boss and immediately kill the enemies it spawns.

Phase 2

When Metyr reaches close to 50% health, phase 2 will begin. Metyr will pause for a moment and gather gravitational magic into its tail, creating a black hole. This transition creates a vortex of magic near Metyr that will keep hitting the player if they stay near it. Metyr will then lift off the ground and create a second large shockwave.

When you see the transition start, back away from Metyr to avoid the first pulse. If you continue running away after the initial vortex forms, you'll avoid the secondary blast. However, if you think you're still too close to Metyr and won't be able to avoid the second blast by sprinting alone, dodge a moment after Metyr's arms leave the ground.

Here are the attacks to look out for in Phase 2:

Attack Name

Description

How To Dodge

Helicopter Body Slam

Metyr will lift off the ground and start spinning around before crashing into the player.

Sprint away the moment you see Metyr lift off the ground and continue sprinting until Metyr touches the ground. If Metyr gets too close to you when it crash lands, dodge roll as Metyr's body slides at you. While it's possible to dodge roll through this attack without sprinting first, the timing is extremely strict in medium armor. It's also possible to use a shield with 100% physical resistance and block this attack.

Black Holes Minefield

The black hole on Metyr's tail will lift its hind section into the air while its arms are stretched outward. Metyr will then lift its arms upward and a minefield of black holes will be summoned around the player. These black holes will explode when they come into contact with another body or after a short duration of time.

When you see Metyr lift off the ground, sprint directly to your left or right and continue sprinting until the attack is over. This will move you out of the minefield and has the added benefit of making Metyr's next attack move it out of the minefield as well.

Charged Head Slam

Metyr's head starts smoking and it'll wrap its arms around its body. Metyr then slams its head into the ground, lighting up the area and causing it to explode after a short duration. This attack can sometimes be done in phase 1, but it's seen more in phase 2.

Sprint to one of Metyr's sides. Once you're clear of the explosive area, you have a window to attack. Alternatively, if you are far away enough, there are gaps where the ground will not explode. You can sit in these empty gaps and continue casting spells.

Triple Laser

This attack replaces Phase 1's laser shot. Metyr charges its laser at its head and fires three laser shots at the player

Sprinting and dodge rolling will usually get you through two of the lasers, but a laser usually sneaks through one way or another. Repeated Bloodhound Steps or Miriam's Vanishing can help you avoid this attack, but that's a large amount of FP investment for a minor attack.

Double Laser Sweep

This attack and triple lasers are the bane of every "no-hit" run against this boss. Metyr will put its hands onto its chest, and its black hole will glow and lift its body off the ground. A vortex of magic will be created around the boss, damaing the player if they get too close. Metyr will then create two lasers pointed in opposite directions and sweep them at the player.

Run toward the vortex and hug the bare edges of it. There's a small gap where the lasers can't reach you and the vortex won't hit you either. The spacing for the first laser sweep is strict. After that, continue sprinting counterclockwise to Metyr (following the path of the laser) to avoid the second sweep. Failing that, use Miriam's Vanishing then Ash of War: Bloodhound's Step to completely dodge through the first laser sweep.

Recommended Equipment Against Metyr, Mother of Fingers

  • Any weapon or spells that inflict bleed or frostbite are ideal against Metyr because of its weak resistance to these elements
    • The Impenetrable Thorns sorcery is perfect for this fight
    • Rivers of Blood is also a good choice against this boss

  • Spells that hit a wide range multiple times are also good against Metyr
  • High Vigor/Shadowrealm Blessing
  • If you have the Comet Azur railgun build, this is an ideal fight for it

Metyr is weak to Hemorrhage and Frostbite, which means classic bleed builds like Rivers of Blood builds will shine in this fight. For Sorcery builds, Impenetrable Thorns will tear through Metyr's health because it can hit a wide area multiple times and inflict bleed, making it ideal against Metyr's wide body.

On that note, other spells that hit a wide area multiple times can also take advantage of how large Metyr's body is. Shard Spiral , Meteorite of Astel , Pest-Thread Spears , and Burn, O Flame! are perfect examples of this.

High Vigor (55 or more)/Shadowrealm Blessing(10 or more) are recommended here just so you can make mistakes against this boss without getting one-shot. While its physical attacks are slow and cumbersome, its magic attacks can still deal large chunks of damage and can take some getting used to dodge. With high enough vigor/shadowrealm blessing, you'll be able to take these hits and find time to heal during the fight.

Best Strategies Against Metyr, Mother Of Fingers

Melee Build

After every string of attacks, you'll have the opportunity to squeeze in either a light attack or an uncharged heavy attack. Position yourself so your melee strikes hit the squishy red opening on Metyr's body for maximum damage. Not only does this increase the damage you deal, it also decreases the chances that Metyr will do its finger crawling attack, which can be obnoxious to dodge for a melee build.

Additionally, be patient with Metyr's physical attacks. They will be slow at first followed by a fast acceleration, and the consequence for mistiming your dodge will be a large chunk of your health bar. Time your dodges for the moment the attacks start accelerating toward you, or if it's an attack that requires Metyr to leap upward, dodge as it's headed back toward the ground.

Metyr's poise does not stay broken for very long. If you hit this boss enough that you break their poise, do not waste any time and head straight to the critical hit spot.

For melee builds, be sure to keep a careful eye out for times when Metyr pianos its front fingers, or prepares to finger crawl at you. Both of these attacks do a surprising amount of damage, come out fairly fast for Metyr, and must be dodged by rolling backward. These attacks are also more likely to happen depending on where you position yourself. If you're extremely close to its body in the front, this boss is more likely to piano its front fingers. If you're off to its side and close to its body, Metyr is more likely to finger crawl or splay out its side fingers. Between the two, you'll want to stay in the front, focus on its soft weak spot, and be prepared to roll back when Metyr leans backward.

In phase 2, the biggest attacks to look out for are the giant spinning laser sweeps, triple beams, and helicopter attack. Both the spinning beams and triple beams are not easy to dodge, but the damage from them shouldn't one-hit kill you. The helicopter attack requires you to immediately start sprinting the moment you see Metyr lifting off the ground. Since you're more likely to be fairly close to Metyr when it starts this attack, you may still have to throw in a dodge if Metyr lands and slides too close to you.

Ranged Build

If you have the Comet Azur one-shot build ready, this is the ideal boss fight to use it. Metyr doesn't move very fast, and there's no cinematic splitting the two phases apart so you can hyper beam your way through this entire boss fight.

If you don't want to use that strategy, spells that inflict bleed or frostbite are the ideal picks here since Metyr is weak to those elements. As noted earlier, Impenetrable Thorns is a fantastic spell because it hits such a wide area and can tear through Metyr's health bar thanks to Metyr's large size.

With all of that in mind, your game plan with magic still boils down to usual strategy of stay away from the boss and use as many spells as you can get away with. Summons will help with this, but many of Metyr's attacks have enough recovery to them that you should be able to fit in a spell cast. Mimic Tear Ashes equipped with a bleed or cold weapon/spell can also trigger hemorrhage or frostbite faster, while also taking the aggro off of you.

Incantation users may want to get a bit closer, since spells like Pest-Thread Spears are best used up close.

During phase 2, when Metyr uses its spinning lasers, you can dodge the first sweep of the beam with Miriam's Vanishing followed by Bloodhound Step, but afterward, if you stick close to the vortex, the second beam's sweep will miss. During that time, you'll be able to cast as many spells as you want until the move is done. While this move is a nightmare for melee users, it's a fantastic damage window for ranged builds.

Metyr's Helicopter shouldn't be too hard to dodge either since you're already far enough away when this attack starts that it should miss if you sprint far enough away. Be ready to dodge roll just in case it gets too close. If Metyr lands a good distance away from you, take that as an opportunity to sling more spells in its direction.

Reward For Defeating Metyr, Mother of Fingers

After you defeat Metyr, you'll be rewarded with 420,000 runes, Remembrance of the Mother of Fingers , and you'll get to conrtinue Ymir's quest. Head back to the Church's site of grace and the next step will be waiting for you there.

item.title: Shadow of the Erdtree: All Great Katanas (& How to Get Them)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Great Katanas in the Elden Ring DLC
  • How to Get the Great Katana in Shadow of the Erdtree
  • How to Get the Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana in Shadow of the Erdtree
  • How to Get Rakshasa's Great Katana in Shadow of the Erdtree

Of all the new weapon types in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree , the new Great Katanas may be the most exciting. These new swords mix the dexterity-based finesse of katanas with the strength-based brute force of greatswords. This powerful combination allows for the best of both worlds, with players getting to utilize blood-loss-inducing and poise-breaking attacks. This guide will show players where they can find all Great Katanas in Shadow of the Erdtree, and explain what makes each of them special.

All Great Katanas in the Elden Ring DLC

Weapon Name

Key Details

Where to Find

Great Katana

  • Basic Great Katana.
  • Upgraded with basic Smithing Stones
  • Weapon Skill: Overhead Stance

  • Gravesite Plains
  • West of the Greatbridge, North site of grace, you'll find a large, shallow pond that is home to a Ghostflame Dragon. The Great Katana is found on a dead body in the water.

Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana

  • Special Great Katana
  • Upgraded with Somber Smithing Stones
  • Weapon Skill: Dragonwound Slash

  • Gravesite Plains - Dragon's Pit: Defeat the Ancient Dragon-Man to receive the Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana.

Rakshasa's Great Katana

  • Special Great Katana
  • Upgraded with Somber Smithing Stones
  • Weapon Skill: Weed Cutter

  • Scadu Altus - Eastern Nameless Mausoleum: Head through the hidden path that leads to the lower Scadu Altus. This sword will be awarded after defeating Rakshasa in the mausoleum.

How to Get the Great Katana in Shadow of the Erdtree

The Great Katana can be found very early in Shadow of the Erdtree. You'll need to head north, to the large pond that is visible on the map west of Greatbrdge, North. When you first arrive, you'll find a Ghostflame Dragon that appears to be dead. As you approach the head, you'll see a dead body with a glowing item. This is the Great Katana .

Great Katana Details and Stats:

Attribute Requirements:

STR

DEX

14

18

Base Scaling:

STR

DEX

D

D

Fully Upgraded +25 Scaling:

STR

DEX

D

C

Base Attack:

Physical

145

Magic

0

Fire

0

Lightning

0

Holy

0

Critical

100

  • Weight : 9.0

Great Katana Weapons Skill: Ash of War: Overhead Stance

  • A skill that starts with the blade held high in a ready stance. Execute a normal attack from this stance to step forward and slash downwards, or a strong attack to deliver a series of downward slashes.
  • FP COST: (8/10)
  • This weapon skill is non-chargeable.
  • This Ash of War can be exchanged with other qualifying Ashes of War.

How to Get the Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana in Shadow of the Erdtree

Defeat the Ancient Dragon-Man

The Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana is acquired by defeating the Ancient Dragon-Man in the Dragon's Pit . To reach the Dragon's Pit cave, head south from the Castle Front site of grace in Gravesite Plain. When you reach the first fork, stay left and ride through the spiked barrier. At the second fork, stay right until you start seeing several broken dragon statues. You can follow these statues all the way to the entrance to the Dagon's Pit.

Once you enter the Dragon's Pit cave, you'll want to make your way through to the chamber with the large chasm in between the path and a massive chalice on a stone platform. When you first enter the chamber, you get a hint in the form of written text on the ground. This hint is meant to lead you to the chasm, giving you the courage to jump in. So, this is exactly what you want to do. Jump into the chasm, and you will land in front of Shadow of the Erdtree 's Ancient Dragon-Man boss arena. Defeat the boss to instantly receive the Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana .

Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana Details & Stats

Attrribute Requirements:

STR

DEX

15

20

Base Scaling:

STR

DEX

D

D

Fully Upgraded +10 Scaling:

STR

DEX

C

C

Base Attack:

Physical

152

Magic

0

Fire

0

Lightning

0

Holy

0

Critical

100

  • Weight: 10.5

Dragon-Hunter's Great Katana Weapon Skill : Dragonwound Slash

  • Designed to hunt colossal dragons, this skill cloaks the armament with a jagged gravel-stone aura before performing a high leaping slash. Charge the attack to fire off the aura.
  • FP Use: 18
  • This skill can be charged.
  • This weapon skill cannot be exchanged.

How to Get Rakshasa's Great Katana in Shadow of the Erdtree

Head to the Eastern Nameless Mausoleum

To get Rakshasa's Great Katana in Shadow of the Erdtree, you'll first need to reach the Eastern Nameless Mausoleum. To do this, you'll need to use the hidden path that leads from the Shadow Keep to the lower Scadu Altus. Use these simple steps to complete this first part of the path:

  • After defeating the Golden Hippopotamus, you'll begin down the main path into the Shadow Keep. Not far along the path, you'll reach a bridge that features several raised fire pits that look like small boats. Head down to the end of the bridge, and look for a ladder on the eastern side.
  • Take the ladder down to the small path that runs along the water. Follow the path under the waterfall, then make your way to the chamber with the 'Domain of Dragons' painting. Look for a blank spot on the wall, found to the right if you are looking face-on at the painting. Hit the wall to reveal the rest of the path.
  • Head through the new opening and follow the path until you reach the stone coffin. Interact with the coffin, and it will take you to lower Scadu Altus, dropping you off at the Castle Watering Hole site of grace. This is where you want to start the second half of the path to the Eastern Nameless Mausoleum.

From the Castle Watering Hole site of grace, you can follow the river south to reach two sites of grace. First, the Receluses' River Upstream site will be found to the left of the first waterfall you reach, on a cliffside path that you will follow next. From there, follow the path further until you reach the Recluses' River Downstream site of grace. From here, look over the ledge to find several protruding tombstones that you can use to reach the lower level of the river. When you reach the lower level, head north towards the waterfall, then turn right when you can. Follow this branch of the river around the turn, and you'll eventually find the Eastern Nameless Mausoleum on the edge of a cliff, sitting just to the left of a massive waterfall.

Defeat Rakshasa

Inside the Eastern Nameless Mausoleum, you'll face Rakshasa without the help of any summons. He can be a bit overwhelming if you come into the fight under-leveled. Make sure you have a Scadutree Blessing level of at least +10, preferably more. Watch out for his overuse of the Weed Cutter weapon skill. He will frequently use it three times in a row. Once he is defeated, you will receive Rakshasa's Great Katana and the Rakshasa Set .

Rakshasa's Great Katana Details & Stats

Attribute Requirements:

STR

DEX

12

27

Base Scaling :

STR

DEX

E

C

Fully Upgraded +10 Scaling :

STR

DEX

item.title: Roblox: LOCKED Weapons & Traits Tier List
item.description:
Quick Links

  • LOCKED Weapons Tier List
  • LOCKED Traits Tier List

Since LOCKED is based on the Blue Lock anime, in this experience, soccer is more like a war than a sport. This is not surprising, since each player can have unique abilities. But, of course, not all of them are equally useful during matches.

While Weapons are your main abilities, Traits are something of a secondary weapon. They can also be passive or active. Only by having the right abilities can you become the best striker in this curated Roblox experience.

LOCKED Weapons Tier List

As in the original anime, Weapons play a crucial role in LOCKED . All of them can be divided into three types according to their use: Active, Passive, and Situational (the latter type requiring special conditions for activation). However, they are all obtained in the Customization room by rolling for Yen. To make it easier for you to choose the best weapons in LOCKED , the table below ranks them based on how useful and effective they are.

Weapon Rarity Tier
Planetary Unique S Tier
CopyCat Exotic S Tier
Godspeed Unique S Tier
Watch Tower Exotic S Tier
Serpent Unique S Tier
King Unique S Tier
Formless Unique A Tier
Monster Legendary A Tier
Emperor Unique A Tier
Leader Common A Tier
Nagi Legendary A Tier
Speedster Legendary A Tier
Kunigami Exotic A Tier
Direct Shot Common B Tier
Web Rare B Tier
Sword Screw Legendary B Tier
Iron Head Common B Tier
Snatch Rare B TIer
Voracious Exotic B TIer
Riptide Legendary B TIer
Neurotic Rare C Tier
Shadow Exotic C Tier
Acrobatic Legendary C Tier
Repel Rare C Tier
Long Legs Common C Tier

As you can see, all Weapons are divided by rarity . The rarer the ability, the lower its drop rate. In the case of Unique Weapons, you will need a lot of Yen and luck:

  • Unique - 1%
  • Legendary - 5%
  • Exotic - 10%
  • Rare - 30%
  • Common - 55%

Best LOCKED Weapons

While different Weapons may be suitable for each player, some are particularly effective.

  • CopyCat: This ability allows you to copy the Weapon of one of the players on the enemy team for one turn, except Uniques. Of course, it will take some getting used to, but it is an excellent way to ruin your enemies' strategy.
  • Godspeed: This weapon allows you to rush forward quickly and snatch the ball, even in the air. It is a fairly simple ability, but it can be used in any possible field scenarios.
  • Planetary: Unlike the previous ones, Planetary requires you to play LOCKED as a team. By activating it, after a player on your team kicks the ball, you will teleport to the ball and kick it back to them.

LOCKED Traits Tier List

As for Traits, they are secondary abilities that are no less important in LOCKED . Most of them provide passive buffs, but some can be active. In addition, they are divided into rarities, just like Weapons.

Trait Rarity Tier
Predator Eye Unique S Tier
Athlete Exotic S Tier
Puppeteer Unique S Tier
Golden Zone Legendary A Tier
Fortune Exotic A Tier
Bunnys Exotic A Tier
Tireless Exotic A Tier
Long Strides Rare A Tier
No Look Exotic A Tier
Egoist Legendary A Tier
Meta-Vision Legendary A Tier
Surf Rare B Tier
Quick Draw Exotic B Tier
Tank Rare B Tier
Claw Exotic B Tier
Diver Exotic B Tier
Ambidextrous Legendary B Tier
Unbreakable Exotic B Tier
Ripper Exotic B Tier
Powerhouse Rare C Tier
Consistent Exotic C Tier
Heavy Rare C Tier
Clamps Rare C Tier
Dwarf Common D Tier
Tired Common D Tier
Lazy Common D Tier
Weak Common D Tier

Best LOCKED Traits

Of course, players should try different Traits in LOCKED to find the ones that best suit their builds. However, some of them have great variability and effectiveness in matches. Here are a few of the most beneficial Traits:

  • Predator Eye: This active ability allows you to shoot a ball in a straight line with great speed.
  • Athlete: With this Trait, you passively receive a jump, speed, and power shot boost. In other words, your character becomes much more potent than most other players.
  • Puppeteer: During a match, you can give an extra flow to your five closest teammates. This ability works even if those players do not have enough ego.

item.title: Where To Get Multilayered Ring Of Light In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get The Multilayered Ring Of Light In Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • How Powerful Is Multilayered Ring Of Light

Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree adds a wide array of new incantations that fit both into the existing classes along with creating their own. One incantation players can find is Multilayered Ring of Light , which is a new Golden Order incantation.

This Incantation offers lots of versatility in combat, as it can be used at a range while also causing damage over time in a specific location. To get this incantation, players will need to approach the Shadow Keep and get the message that, "Somewhere a Great Rune has broken."

Where To Get The Multilayered Ring Of Light In Shadow Of The Erdtree

After getting close to the Shadow Keep and seeing the message, players will need to head south and reach the Cerulean Coast. Continue heading to the very southern peninsula and find the Stone Coffin Fissure before heading down. This dungeon is mostly linear, with players eventually reaching the Fissure Waypoint Site Of Grace.

From this Site of Grace, head northeast and jump over the small gap to reach the other side. Fight your way through the few skeletons coming down the ramp and reach the room with the giant slime. From this room, take a right and head out into the next open area to find a golden Misbegotten Crusader . This enemy shouldn't cause too much trouble and doesn't have any resistance to Standard, Slash, or Fire damage. Defeating this enemy will reward players with the Multilayered Ring of Light incantation.

How Powerful Is Multilayered Ring Of Light

  • Requires: 36 Faith
  • FP Cost - 23
  • Slots Used - 1

Multilayered Ring of Light targets an enemy and after being thrown, will expand around the enemy's location. During the next few seconds, the ring will spin repeatedly, damaging any nearby enemy and stunning them if they are small enough. This spell is a great option against crowds, and just as useful against powerful enemies the same size as the player.

The damage done by the ring lasts for a few seconds and can be increased by charging up the spell before releasing it. While it does have a higher faith cost, the stun-locking potential of this spell will damage enemies while also giving the player a chance to reposition and charge up another ring or a better spell. This spell is very difficult to miss if you're going through the Stone Coffin Fissu and should be sued by any faith build if they have the memory slot for it.
